intro: Stylidium rupestre f. congestum, commonly known as the clustered stickless plant, is a variant of the stickless plant species native to Australia. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, often hairy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually greenish or reddish, and it is known for its ability to produce numerous small, sticky seeds. This plant is part of the family Haemodoraceae, which includes other species with similar floral structures and growth habits.
